title: The Causes and effects of the main character's depression in Yasunari Kawabata's the sound of the mountain
abstract: The Sound of the Mountain portrays the life of Yasunari Kawabata?s main character, Ogata Shingo who has experienced some of painful events in his life that bring him into psychological problems. The thesis writer finds the psychological problem of the main character is depression. The thesis writer is eager to find out the causes and effects of Ogata Shingo?s depression. To obtain the purpose of this thesis, the thesis writer applies literary approach by using the theory of conflict and characterization. The thesis writer also uses the concept of depression to support the analysis. These theories and concept are used in order to help the thesis writer recognize the causes and effects of Ogata Shingo?s depression.
contributors: Liem Satya Limanta (Advisor 1); Sarah Limuil (Advisor 2); Dr. Dra. Yuli Christiana Yoedo, M.Pd. (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: JAPANESE FICTION-20TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; KAWABATA, YASUNARI, ... -1972. THE SOUND OF THE MOUNTAIN-STUDY AND TEACHING
